speaker: FALSTAFF
text: What’s your name, sir? Of what condition are

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: you, and of what place, I pray?

speaker: COLEVILE
text: I am a knight, sir, and my name is Colevile of

speaker: COLEVILE
text: the Dale.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Well then, Colevile is your name, a knight is

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: your degree, and your place the Dale. Colevile shall

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: be still your name, a traitor your degree, and the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: dungeon your place, a place deep enough so shall

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: you be still Colevile of the Dale.

speaker: COLEVILE
text: Are not you Sir John Falstaff?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: As good a man as he, sir, whoe’er I am. Do

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: you yield, sir, or shall I sweat for you? If I do sweat,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: they are the drops of thy lovers and they weep for

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: thy death. Therefore rouse up fear and trembling,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: and do observance to my mercy.

speaker: COLEVILE
text: I think you are Sir John Falstaff, and in that

speaker: COLEVILE
text: thought yield me.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I have a whole school of tongues in this belly

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: of mine, and not a tongue of them all speaks any

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: other word but my name. An I had but a belly of any

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: indifferency, I were simply the most active fellow in

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Europe. My womb, my womb, my womb undoes

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: me. Here comes our general.

JOHN
               
              OF
               
              LANCASTER
text:
The
               
              heat
               
              is
               
              past
              .
               
              Follow
               
              no
               
              further
               
              now
              .

Call
               
              in
               
              the
               
              powers
              ,
               
              good
               
              cousin
               
              Westmoreland
              .

JOHN
               
              OF
               
              LANCASTER
text:
Now
              ,
               
              Falstaff
              ,
               
              where
               
              have
               
              you
               
              been
               
              all
               
              this
               
              while
              ?

speaker:
JOHN
               
              OF

text:
When
               
              everything
               
              is
               
              ended
              ,
               
              then
               
              you
               
              come
              .

JOHN
               
              OF

text:
These
               
              tardy
               
              tricks
               
              of
               
              yours
               
              will
              ,
               
              on
               
              my
               
              life
              ,

JOHN

text:
One
               
              time
               
              or
               
              other
               
              break
               
              some
               
              gallows’
               
              back
              .

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I would be sorry, my lord, but it should be

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: thus. I never knew yet but rebuke and check was the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: reward of valor. Do you think me a swallow, an

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: arrow, or a bullet? Have I in my poor and old

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: motion the expedition of thought? I have speeded

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: hither with the very extremest inch of possibility. I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: have foundered ninescore and odd posts, and here,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: travel-tainted as I am, have in my pure and immaculate

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: valor taken Sir John Colevile of the Dale, a most

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: furious knight and valorous enemy. But what of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: that? He saw me and yielded, that I may justly say,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: with the hook-nosed fellow of Rome, “There, cousin,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I came, saw, and overcame.”

speaker:
JOHN
               
              OF
               
              LANCASTER
text: It was more of his courtesy than

speaker:
JOHN
               
              OF
               
              LANCASTER
text: your deserving.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I know not. Here he is, and here I yield him.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: And I beseech your Grace let it be booked with the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: rest of this day’s deeds, or, by the Lord, I will have it

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: in a particular ballad else, with mine own picture

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: on the top on ’t, Colevile kissing my foot; to the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: which course if I be enforced, if you do not all show

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: like gilt twopences to me, and I in the clear sky of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: fame o’ershine you as much as the full moon doth

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: the cinders of the element (which show like pins’

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: heads to her), believe not the word of the noble.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Therefore let me have right, and let desert mount.

speaker:
JOHN
               
              OF
               
              LANCASTER
text: Thine’s too heavy to mount.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Let it shine, then.

speaker:
JOHN
               
              OF
               
              LANCASTER
text: Thine’s too thick to shine.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Let it do something, my good lord, that may

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: do me good, and call it what you will.

speaker:
JOHN
               
              OF
               
              LANCASTER
text: Is thy name Colevile?

speaker: COLEVILE
text: It is, my lord.

text: Colevile.

I

That

You

text: I know not how they sold themselves, but

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: thou, like a kind fellow, gavest thyself away gratis,

speaker: FALSTAFF

Now

Retreat

To

Blunt

I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: My lord, I beseech you give me leave to go

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: through Gloucestershire, and, when you come to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: court, stand my good lord, pray, in your good

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: report.

speaker:
JOHN
               
              OF
               
              LANCASTER
text:
Fare
               
              you
               
              well
              ,

              .
               
              I
              ,
               
              in
               
              my
               
              condition
              ,

speaker:
JOHN
               
              OF

text:
Shall
               
              better
               
              speak
               
              of
               
              you
               
              than
               
              you

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I would you had but the wit; ’twere better

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: than your dukedom. Good faith, this same young

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: sober-blooded boy doth not love me, nor a man

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: cannot make him laugh. But that’s no marvel; he

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: drinks no wine. There’s never none of these demure

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: boys come to any proof, for thin drink doth so

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: overcool their blood, and making many fish meals,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: that they fall into a kind of male green-sickness, and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: then, when they marry, they get wenches. They are

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: generally fools and cowards, which some of us

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: should be too, but for inflammation. A good sherris

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: sack hath a two-fold operation in it. It ascends me

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: into the brain, dries me there all the foolish and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: dull and crudy vapors which environ it, makes it

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: apprehensive, quick, forgetive, full of nimble, fiery,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: and delectable shapes, which, delivered o’er to the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: voice, the tongue, which is the birth, becomes

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: excellent wit. The second property of your excellent

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: sherris is the warming of the blood, which,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: before cold and settled, left the liver white and pale,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: which is the badge of pusillanimity and cowardice.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: But the sherris warms it and makes it course from

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: the inwards to the parts’ extremes. It illumineth the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: face, which as a beacon gives warning to all the rest

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: of this little kingdom, man, to arm; and then the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: vital commoners and inland petty spirits muster me

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: all to their captain, the heart, who, great and puffed

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: up with this retinue, doth any deed of courage, and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: this valor comes of sherris. So that skill in the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: weapon is nothing without sack, for that sets it

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: a-work; and learning a mere hoard of gold kept

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: by a devil till sack commences it and sets it in

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: act and use. Hereof comes it that Prince Harry is

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: valiant, for the cold blood he did naturally inherit

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: of his father he hath, like lean, sterile, and bare

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: land, manured, husbanded, and tilled with excellent

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: endeavor of drinking good and good store

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: of fertile sherris, that he is become very hot and valiant.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: If I had a thousand sons, the first human principle

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I would teach them should be to forswear

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: thin potations and to addict themselves to sack.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: How now, Bardolph?

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: The army is discharged all and gone.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Let them go. I’ll through Gloucestershire,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: and there will I visit Master Robert Shallow,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Esquire. I have him already temp’ring between my

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: finger and my thumb, and shortly will I seal with

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: him. Come away.
